action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the zimwi isn’t already grappling a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 11).

monster.name: Ziphius
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the ziphius moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a dorsal fin attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 27 (5d10) slashing damage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The ziphius deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Telepathic Foresight
trait.text: As a bonus action at the start of its turn, the ziphius can choose one creature within 120 feet that it can see. The ziphius’ eyes glow, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or the ziphius creates a temporary mental bond with the target until the start of the ziphius’ next turn. While bonded, the ziphius reads the creature’s surface thoughts, choosing to either gain advantage on attacks against that target or cause the target to have disadvantage on attacks against the ziphius.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The ziphius can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ziphius makes one beak attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the ziphius. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the ziphius, and it takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of the ziphius’ turns. The ziphius can have only one target swallowed at a time.

If the ziphius takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the ziphius must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the ziphius. If the ziphius dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Dorsal Fin
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.name: Zmey Headling
monster.resist: cold, fire

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The zmey headling can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The zmey headling reaver regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. This trait doesn’t function if the zmey headling took acid or fire damage since the end of its previous turn. It dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zmey headling makes one claw attack and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 6)
action.text: The zmey headling exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area takes 16 (3d10) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.

monster.name: Zmey
monster.resist: cold, fire
monster.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 90 ft., passive Perception 18

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The zmey can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Lake Leap
trait.text: A zmey spends much of its time lurking in lakes and ponds. When submerged in a natural pool of standing water, it can transport itself as a bonus action to a similar body of water within 5,000 feet. Rapidly flowing water doesn’t serve for this ability, but the zmey can leap to or from a river or stream where the water is calm and slow-moving.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
trait.text: If the zmey fails a saving throw, it can count it as a success instead.

trait.name: Multiheaded
trait.text: The zmey normally has three heads. While it has more than one head, the zmey has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and stunned. If the zmey takes 40 or more damage in a single turn (and the damage isn’t poison or psychic), one of its heads is severed. If all three of its heads are severed, the zmey dies.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The zmey regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zmey takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the zmey’s next turn. Regeneration stops functioning when all heads are severed. It takes 24 hours for a zmey to regrow a functional head.

trait.name: Spawn Headling
trait.text: The severed head of a zmey grows into a zmey headling 2d6 rounds after being separated from the body. Smearing at least a pound of salt on the severed head’s stump prevents this transformation.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zmey makes one bite attack per head and one claws attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The zmey breathes up to three 60-foot cones of fire, one from each of its heads. Creatures in a cone take 16 (3d10) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. If cones overlap, their damage adds together but each target makes only one saving throw. A zmey can choose whether this attack harms plants or plant creatures.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: The zmey makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The zmey makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Trample
legendary.text: The zmey moves up to half its land speed. It can enter enemy-occupied spaces but can’t end its move there. Creatures in spaces the zmey enters must make successful DC 14 Dexterity saving throws or take 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and fall prone.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.name: Zoryas
monster.resist: fire, radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nomagical attacks

trait.name: Fire and Light
trait.text: The zoryas’ weapon attacks are magical. When the zoryas hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 radiant or fire damage (included in the attack). The zoryas chooses whether its attack does radiant or fire damage before making the attack roll.

trait.name: Open Celestial Gate
trait.text: As an action, the zoryas opens a gateway to the celestial plane. The gate appears as a shimmering circle that sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet and is framed by twisting, golden strands. The gate lasts 1 hour; though, the zoryas can choose to close it at any time as a bonus action. Once the gate closes, the zoryas is reduced to 0 hp and remains unconscious for six days, awakening, fully restored, at sunrise on the seventh day. The zoryas can’t pass through its own gate.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The zoryas regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the zoryas takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the zoryas’ next turn. The zoryas’ body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

trait.name: Sun’s Guidance (3/Day)
trait.text: The zoryas has advantage on melee attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The angel makes two morningstar attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) radiant or fire damage.

action.name: Light of Dawn (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: The zoryas’ lantern brightens, bathing its environs in brilliant light. Each creature within 30 feet of the zoryas must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded for 1d4 rounds. An undead creature who fails this save also takes 13 (3d8) fire damage. The light dispels up to three spells or other magical effects of 3rd level or lower like the dispel magic spell within the area.

action.name: Dusk’s Arrival (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: The zoryas’ lantern darkens, snuffing out nearby natural and magical sources of light. Each creature within 30 feet of the zoryas must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area is bathed in darkness like the darkness spell until the end of the zoryas’ next turn.
